page.title: 12HISTORY (FROYLE/HOLYBOURNE)
page.content: There was a a church in Froyle at the time of Domesday, owned by the nuns of Winchester. There were apple orchards and later hop fields in the village. There are Tudor, Georgian and Victorian houses and farms. Roads have always crossed the area. The Harrow Way was a{prehistoric track near the hill fort at Dickets Plantation. There were two{Roman {roads}and later the mediaeval road through Alice Holt by the pass of Alton. Pilgrims travelled past{Froyle Cross along the{Pilgrims Way.} The main road was a coaching route and the railway was built alongside it. The modern bypass made the village a quiet backwater
